description: '''Kay Starr''' (born '''Catherine Laverne Starks'''; July 21, 1922 â€“ November 3, 2016) was an American singer who enjoyed considerable success in the late 1940s and 1950s. She was of [[Iroquois]] and Irish heritage. Starr performed multiple genres, such as pop, jazz, and country, but her roots were in jazz. Her 1952 song "[[Wheel of Fortune (1951 song)|Wheel of Fortune]]" was a smash hit, and later inducted into the [[Grammy Hall of Fame]]. Additionally, she had big hits with "Allez-Vous-En" (from the Broadway Show CAN-CAN) and "If You Love Me (Really Love Me)" in 1953 and 1954, respectively.
